data.question: What is the main environmental concern addressed by the development of highly hydrophobic porous materials?
data.answer: The capture of harmful volatile organic compounds.

data.question: What is the role of metal–azolate coordinative bonds in the [Ni8(L)6] MOFs?
data.answer: They confer high stability to the materials.

data.question: Why were Boc-protected pyrazole rings used in the synthesis of the [Ni8(L)6] family?
data.answer: To facilitate the precipitation of powders with a high degree of crystallinity.

data.question: What is the effect of extending the spacer in the [Ni8(L)6] MOFs?
data.answer: It increases the hydrophobicity of the frameworks.

data.question: True or False: The [Ni8(L)6] MOFs are sensitive to moisture.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the [Ni8(L5-CF3)6] MOF in terms of hydrophobicity?
data.answer: It is highly hydrophobic and outperforms Blücher-101408 in moisture resistance.

data.question: True or False: The [Ni8(L)6] MOFs containing bipyrazolate linkers are not stable in environmental moisture.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the main advantage of [Ni8(L5-CF3)6] over other [Ni8(L)6] MOFs in air purification processes?
data.answer: Its high hydrophobic nature allows efficient capture of harmful VOCs even in moist conditions.

data.question: True or False: The introduction of trifluoroalkyl residues in a MOF does not significantly increase its hydrophobicity.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the main challenge in synthesizing the [Ni8(L)6] family of MOFs?
data.answer: The notable strength of the Ni–azolate bonds induces extremely fast precipitation and poor solubility.

data.question: How does the [Ni8(L5-CF3)6] MOF perform in capturing diethylsulfide (DES) under humid conditions?
data.answer: It efficiently captures DES, demonstrating its effectiveness in air purification even in the presence of moisture.

data.question: True or False: All [Ni8(L)6] materials crystallize in the cubic Fm-3m space group.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the impact of linker functionalization on the [Ni8(L)6] MOFs' adsorption capacity and specific surface area?
data.answer: Linker functionalization modifies the surface polarity without significantly affecting the accessibility of probe molecules to the porous network.

data.question: True or False: The [Ni8(L)6] MOFs exhibit type I isotherms, characteristic of microporous crystalline solids.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of the trifluoromethyl group in the [Ni8(L5-CF3)6] MOF?
data.answer: It significantly increases the hydrophobicity of the material.

data.question: True or False: The thermal stability of the [Ni8(L)6] MOFs is compromised by the presence of bipyrazolate linkers.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the main application focus of the [Ni8(L)6] MOFs?
data.answer: The capture of harmful volatile organic compounds in environmental remediation.

data.question: How does the [Ni8(L5-CF3)6] MOF compare to Blücher-101408 in terms of hydrophobicity?
data.answer: It is more hydrophobic than Blücher-101408, making it superior in moisture resistance.

data.question: True or False: The [Ni8(L)6] MOFs are not suitable for applications involving the capture of organic molecules in moist environments.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of Boc-protected pyrazole rings in the synthesis process of the [Ni8(L)6] MOFs?
data.answer: They slow the release of the ligand in the reaction medium, aiding in the formation of highly crystalline powders.
